reviews.text: This was a perfect replacement for my original switch that I installed about 9 years ago. With everyone going in and out of our pantry as often as they do, this is probably the most-used light switch in the house, and the fact that it lasted 9 years before it went out is a testament to its durability and longevity. The button failed on my last unit and I'm hoping to get another 9-10 years out of this one.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.title: Great replacement

reviews.text: Just instal a few weeks ago so can't rate durability. trusting it last a very long time. Lee products are normally very reliable. The door is to a pantry. Very HAPPY with this switch. It works well and the measurements were good as it replaced a door switch and the cover plate measured 3.5" long. I wish all products would list as this one did, the width, height and length when offering items. It is extremely important to have measurements when order these things. Seller was good to show 3.5 inch length. This Included an electrical box if one is doing a new install. The width worked out because of the comments form buyers were very good to post and show the door jams etc and write comments. The old door switch (to a large kitchen pantry) quit working after 40 years, go figure. LOL, and was hard wired. This product had enough lead wire and workable to hard wire with wire nuts (not included) and also to simply wrap a band of electrical tape (not included) around for second security. Tape may not be needed with wire nuts but added safety. The brass screws included, good length, fit the former holes. All in all, it is a great ending to a search for: "where is a door switch to replace this 40+ year old switch. Great find and quality product! Would use this company again. NO brick and mortar electrical store or hardware store had anything like this. Thank you LEE ELECTRIC!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2023
reviews.title: Works well, installed few weeks ago, brass door plate 5stars and hoping long durability.

reviews.title: If work for long time is good???

reviews.text: I bought this to replace an identical one which failed in under a year. My brother also had one that failed in under a year. It's easy to replace, but the switch itself is cheaply made and just doesn't last. So far, I have not found a better alternative, so if you buy, just expect to replace at least once per year. I found a source for the internal plastic switch, which simply snaps into the assembly, but it consts as much as the whole assembly. The switches by themselves should sell for around $1 per each, but they do not. If I could source the switches separatly and cheaply, I would just keep some on hand so I would have new ones when they break.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2023
reviews.title: They don't last very long

reviews.text: **make sure your width is as tight and precise as you can make it. The face plate is the same width as the gang box.** It would be nice if it was a 1/8th wider. I would go with another brand if that was the case and you want a better finish look. The brass finish has the look and texture if a brass spray paint. The gang box isn’t very rigid and can be easily deformed if forced in. It is made by folding a piece of metal over, origami style and none of the seams are connected.

reviews.text: Very nice appearance and function. The force needed to activate these is very low, and there's a significant "breakaway" after activation so the force to keep them depressed is smaller still. I used these to replace some ancient switches that were so hard to press that the door couldn't hold them shut without a super strong latch. With these, I don't even need a latch, as the small amount of door friction can hold them in. Be sure you measure your existing switch to make sure these are an exact fit. If so, I think youll be very happy with these. I would NOT recommend these for new installations. As others have noted, installing these from scratch in old work is not simple.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2022
reviews.title: Low force switch better than what I replaced.

reviews.text: Switch is solidly built, not much plastic. Doesn’t feel cheaply made. Not easy to install once doors are already in, much better to do when originally installing door jambs. I have done both with this switch, using one after the door was installed, and had to cut out the jamb to fit the switch. The install with the new door frame was much easier, prepping the cuts before the door went in. Would buy again!
